node.title: Latest on COVID from around the world: Nearly 90 pct of cases in England now Omicron, US infections double
node.content: ["Here's the latest on the COVID-19 pandemic from around the world.\n", "President Joe Biden has pledged to ease a shortage of COVID-19 tests as the Omicron variant spreads across US states this holiday week, threatening to overwhelm hospitals and stifle travel plans.", "US airlines canceled nearly 1000 flights on Monday after grounding thousands of planes over the Christmas holiday weekend, hobbled by staff shortages from COVID-19 infections and bad weather in parts of the country.", "Monday's air travel woes capped a glum holiday weekend for thousands of passengers who were stranded in airports and waiting in hours-long customer service lines to re-book flights, often for days after originally planned.", "Rapidly rising COVID-19 infections from the Omicron variant have forced airlines to cancel flights as pilots and cabin crew fall sick and need to quarantine.", "The average number of new COVID-19 cases in the US has risen 55 percent to over 205,000 per day over the past seven days, according to a Reuters tally.", "On Monday, snowy weather in the Pacific Northwest was also part of the reason for more than 80 canceled flights that were due to land at Seattle-Tacoma Airport.", "A representative for Alaska Airlines, which cancelled more than 120 flights on Monday due partially to snowy conditions in Seattle, told a passenger on Twitter it would be hours before someone from the airline's customer service could speak by phone, signalling the extent to which airline phone lines were overwhelmed with frustrated passengers.", "Meanwhile, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said on Monday it was investigating nearly 70 cruise ships after reports of COVID-19 cases on board.", "The country has confirmed its first three cases of the Omicron variant of the coronavirus, its Health Ministry said on Monday, adding the infections were detected in people who had travelled outside the country this month.", "Health Secretary Sajid Javid says the highly transmissible Omicron variant of COVID-19 now accounts for about 90 percent of cases across England and urged people to celebrate New Year cautiously.\u00a0", "Despite Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland all bringing in new rules on Boxing Day, England will not get any new COVID-19 restrictions before the end of 2021, Javid says. Prime Minister Boris Johnson continues to resist new measures, which would be unpopular within his own Conservative party.", "The government's attention is focused on the number of patients being hospitalised with Omicron after early data last week suggested the variant carried a lower risk of admission.", "According to the latest data, the number of patients in hospitals in England with COVID-19 was its highest since March, at 8474, but a long way off peaks above 34,000 in January.", "A combination of factors, including the UK's vaccination programme, the lag between infections and hospitalisations and the potentially less harmful effects of the Omicron variant have all been put forward by health experts as possible explanations for lower numbers.", "The UK reported 98,515 new cases of COVID-19 on Monday and 143 deaths within 28 days of a positive test result.", "The health ministry reported 142 coronavirus-related deaths on Monday against 81 the day before, while the daily tally of new infections rose to 30,810 from 24,883.", "Health experts are urging the Italian government to relax COVID-19 quarantine rules, saying the country otherwise risked paralysis as the highly infectious Omicron variant spreads.", "The country on Monday announced further restrictions effective from January 3 - 16 to contain a further upsurge in COVID-19 infections including the Omicron variant, targeting mainly night-time entertainment venues.", "Swiss drugs regulator Swissmedic said on Monday it approved booster doses for Johnson & Johnson's COVID-19 vaccine in people 18 years and older who have received the first vaccination.", "An Israeli hospital administered fourth COVID-19 vaccine doses to a test group of health workers on Monday, in what it called the first major study into whether the second round of boosters will help contend with the fast-spreading Omicron variant.", "The country has announced it will not allow employees in the public or private sectors to enter their workplace without a COVID-19 vaccination certificate proving they are fully vaccinated.", "Travellers from the UK, France, Denmark and Norway have been banned from entering Iran for 15 days.", "COVID-19 infections are decreasing in India, with 6642 new cases reported on average each day. That represents 2 percent of the highest daily average reported on May 9.", "Australian authorities refrained from imposing new COVID-19 curbs despite the country's first Omicron death, saying hospitalisation rates remained low.", "Emergency use of Pfizer's antiviral pills targeting COVID-19 as the first of its kind were authorised to be introduced in the country.", "China's Kintor Pharmaceutical Ltd said data from a Phase III clinical trial for its potential COVID-19 treatment proxalutamide in non-hospitalised patients did not meet statistical criteria in the interim analysis due to the low number of hospitalisations.", "Japan's Shionogi & Co Ltd started a phase III clinical trial in Vietnam for a new COVID-19 vaccine.", "Bharat Biotech's COVID-19 vaccine, Covaxin, will be the only shot available to children aged 15 to 18 when inoculation begins for them from January 3, the Indian health ministry said in its guidelines released on Monday.", "Shares of US airlines and other travel-related companies fell on Monday as rising Omicron cases and weather-related problems forced the cancellation of hundreds more flights, leaving travellers stranded across the country during the holidays.", "A record 103 positive COVID-19 cases were found among players and staff in football's English Premier League over the past week following a raft of fixture postponements during the busy festive period, officials said."]
